citation.article-title: Transfer of Actinosporangium violaceum Krasil'nikov and Yuan, Actinosporangium vitaminophilum Shomura et al. and Actinopycnidium caeruleum Krasil'nikov to the genus Streptomyces, with amended description of the species.

p.s: Description of Streptomyces paradoxus nom. nov.
Streptomyces paradoxus (pa. ra. dox'us. Gr. prep. para amiss, contrary to; Gr. n. doxus an opinion; M.L.n. paradoxus contrary to expectation)
The description is based upon data taken from several sources (Krasil'nikov and Yuan, 1961; Yamaguichi, 1965; Williams et al., 1983).
Aerobic, Gram-positive, mesophilic organisms which form extensively branched substrate and aerial mycelium.
Spore chains are Reticuli-Aperti; the spore surface is smooth.
The aerial spore mass is grey; sclerotia are formed.
Allantoin, adenine, aesculin, arbutin, gelatin, guanine, hypoxanthine, testosterone, tyrosine, urea and xanthine are degraded but chitin, elastin, lecithin, pectin and starch are not.
Hydrogen sulphide is produced but nitrate is not reduced.

L-arabinose, cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, mesoinositol, inulin, D-lactose, mannitol, D-mannose, D-melezitose, D-melibiose, raffinose, L-rhamnose, sucrose, trehalose and D-xylose are used as sole carbon sources but adonitol and xylitol are not.

Grow on L-arginine, L-cysteine, L-histidine, L-hydroxyproline, L-methionine, potassium nitrate, L-serine, L-threonine and L-valine, but not on DL-amino-n-butyric acid or L-phenylalanine, as sole nitrogen sources.
Growth at 10 and 37°C but not at 4 or 45°C.
Tolerant to phenol (0.1% wlv) and sodium chloride (4%, w/v), but not sodium azide (0.01%, w/v).
Sensitive to rifampicin and inhibited by sodium chloride at 7%, w/v.

Antimicrobial activity not shown against Aspergillus niger LIV 131, Bacillus subtilis NCIB 3610, Candida albicans CBS 562, Escherichia coli NCIB 9132, Micrococcus luteus NCIB 196, Pseudomonas fluorescens NCIB 9046, Saccharomyces cerevisiae CBS 171 or Streptomyces murinus ISP 5091.
The peptidoglycan contains LL-diaminopimelic acid as the major diamino acid and is of the A3γ type (Stackebrandt et al., 1981).
The mol % G+C of the DNA has been reported to be 70.4 (Tsyganov et al., 1966), 70.9 (Tsyganov et al., 1970) and 71.6 (Yamaguichi, 1967).
Type strain: ATCC 15813 (= DSM 43350 = KCC 3052 = RIA 655).
